article.headline: Niagara 90, Bucknell 71
article.story: ROCHESTER, N.Y. (AP) -- David Brooks had 23 points and six 3-pointers to lead Niagara to a 90-71 victory over Bucknell Saturday night. James Reaves added 14 points and 13 rebounds for the Purple Eagles (2-0) at the Blue Cross Arena. Tremmel Darden and Alvin Cruz scored 13 each, while Juan Mendez had 10. Kevin Bettencourt led Bucknell (0-3) with 21 points. Niagara held Bucknell scoreless for 4:48 late in the first half, and a jumper by Reaves gave the Purple Eagles a 30-19 lead. The Bisons then reeled off 10 unanswered points to close within one, but Niagara used a 16-1 run to take a 46-30 lead into the break. Buckell cut the lead to 53-41, but Niagara again pulled away, taking its biggest lead of the game at 85-63 with 3:10 left. Niagara went 21-of-26 from the free-throw line, and was 11-for-27 from 3-point range, including seven in the game's first 10 minutes.
